definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc

sentences.english: These indicated that splits had occurred in the enemy camp.
sentences.chinese: 这些说明敌人营垒已出现了分裂。

sentences.english: Pray that God will break the stronghold of persecution and corruption in China.
sentences.chinese: 祷告神会打破中国迫害及腐败的坚固营垒。

sentences.english: Now let us discuss the situation in the camp of China's national revolution.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们来说中国民族革命营垒里的情形。

sentences.english: God and pull down the strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 然后用神话语的宝剑攻破这些营垒。

sentences.english: The traitors were spat on and cursed by the people.
sentences.chinese: 这一卖国贼营垒是中国人民的死敌。

sentences.english: It marked a split within the Kuomintang camp.
sentences.chinese: 这是国民党营垒的破裂。

sentences.english: This camp of traitors are deadly enemies of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 这一卖国贼营垒是中国人民的死敌。

definition: defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
to cache/to hide supplies (from the enemy)
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)

Yingpan, common place name ("army camp")/place near Jintian village 金田村[Jin1 tian2 cun1] in Guangxi where the Taiping Tianguo rebels took their oaths in 1851/place in Xinfeng county 新豐縣|新丰县[Xin1 feng1 Xian4] traditional camping place of brigands/Yingpan township, place name/Yingpan in Shangluo prefecture, Shaanxi/Yingpan township in Yunnan/(many others)
